Posts.Content: abr wrote: I am a 57 year old male who within the last 3 months developed a large, hard lump in my left breast just under the nipple.  After consultation with my family doctor I had a mammogram, followed by an ultrasound.  While waiting for the results I saw a different doctor for another issue who pulled up the results on the hospital network and told me that the lump was a benign tumor and nothing to worry about.  It is rather tender although I would not call it painful.  My question is, is it possible to diagnose a benign tumor from a mammogram and ultrasound?  I thought that only a biopsy could determine whether a mass was benign or malignant.
